description: An Octagonal temple temple 5 miles south-west of Maidenhead. On a gentle hill in a temenos. Lewis (1966) suggests a chronology from the early 4th CE to the early or mid 5th CE.
bibliography: Cotton, A. “Robin Hood’s Arbour and Rectilinear Enclosures in Berkshire.” Berkshire Archaeological Journal 59 (1961): 30.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Weycock Hill (Berkshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Neville, R. “On Roman Remains at Weycock, Berks.” Archaeological Journal 6 (1849): 114.
